abstract: Relatives of Jhessye Shockley, 5-year-old black girl missing from Glendale, Ariz, have criticized the national news media for not giving her disappearance enough attention, but local scrutiny has directed some of the suspicion at her mother Jerice Hunter; Hunter served time in state prison for abusing her other children but angrily dismisses claims she hurt her daughter.
snippet: Relatives of Jhessye Shockley have criticized the national news media for not giving her disappearance enough attention, but local scrutiny has directed some of the suspicion at her mother.
lead_paragraph: Relatives of Jhessye Shockley have criticized the national news media for not giving her disappearance enough attention, but local scrutiny has directed some of the suspicion at her mother.

headline.main: Search for Lost Girl Puts Spotlight on Mother’s Past
headline.print_headline: Search for Lost Girl Puts Spotlight on Mother’s Past
headline.seo: Search in Arizona for Missing Girl, Jhessye Shockley
